file_content.text: I was thirty meters from a computer that would've given me the GEMINI frequency! But no--your idiot brigade had to come in blasting!
Total mission failure! We'll never get another shot at the target, because of you. This is what happens when a criminal gets in the way of real soldiers!
You were surrounded! We saved you!
And blew the mission! If it wasn't for my backup plan, you would've died down there!
"Backup plan?" Your escape route detonated a hospital!
You blew up a hospital getting off Zakuul?
Explain yourself, Kaliyo.
How was I supposed to know what was on the other side of that wall? You expect me to knock?
You're welcome! Next time, I'll let the enemy kill you!
We had them in a corner until you started tossing thermal detonators! I lost four good people because of your lack of discipline!
If they were so good, why are they dead?
I don't care what happened on Zakuul. I'm just happy you two made it back in one piece.
I'm glad you're both alive.
A lot of people weren't so lucky. That's on her.
The reason Kaliyo went in is because Havoc Squad got in trouble.
Accept some blame, Jorgan.
We were expendable. If she'd stayed away, we could've destroyed the fleet's control center.
Enough! You both failed the mission, this Alliance, and me!
You're both useless!
I don't get points for bringing Major Misfire home alive? Good to know for next time.
It wasn't a complete loss. I grabbed something on the way out--
My fire team covered you.
Yeah, yeah... point is, we lifted the datacore from a security console right outside that hyperwave relay station.
It's not the key to the GEMINI frequency, but it does contain a massive file archive all about those droids.
I'll put SCORPIO to work sifting through the information. See if there's anything to salvage from this fiasco.
There's bound to be something we can use. We're not giving up on eliminating Arcann's fleet.
Good idea, Lana.
We won't get a second chance at the hyperwave relay station. We'll just have to hope we find an alternative.
Whatever's in those files has to make up for the lives that were lost getting them.
People died for that data.
Nobody regrets those losses more than me, Commander. The casualties were unacceptable.
"Fiasco" doesn't begin to cover it. If I can't trust you people to complete your missions, what good are you to me?
Incompetence must be punished.
It could've gone much worse, but we can't let this happen again.
Kaliyo disobeyed a direct order from you when she went after Major Jorgan. In the SIS, she'd be classified as a rogue agent and sanctioned accordingly.
Do you have anything to say in your defense?
Kaliyo, how do you plead?
You knew what I was when you hired me. I shouldn't have to apologize.
I don't have time for a trial, and I'm not interested in your excuses.
My sanction will be swift.
I don't care what anyone else thinks. I did the right thing.
You did your best. So did he. That's all I ask. End of discussion.
I agree. Carry on.
If you think of anything you'd like to add... I'll be in your bunk.
Fine. If anyone needs me for the rest of the day... find someone else.
It was a mistake to recruit you, Kaliyo. The Alliance needs people it can trust. That isn't you. Go. Don't come back.
You're exiled--forever.
After everything we've been through, this is how we end?
You know what? That's fine. No--it's perfect.
Yeah? Well, I've been fired from better jobs than this.
We can't just let her leave. She knows our location. Our plans.
She knows what'll happen if she betrays us.
We should get back to work.
You're worse than reckless. You're dangerous. You don't care about anyone but yourself. Serving the Alliance was your last chance, Kaliyo. There's no coming back from this failure.
Your punishment is death.
I always knew it would end like this. Should've kept my job with Nem'ro.
What are you gonna do? Kill me?
Yes. Exactly.
She was your... I can't believe you would....
She had to be dealt with, but that....
Major, perhaps you can arrange a maintenance detail to clean up the mess?
Major Jorgan disobeyed your orders not to follow Kaliyo. In the Republic military, that kind of insubordination is grounds for court-martial.
I'll give you a chance to convince me otherwise, Major.
Defend your actions, Jorgan.
Havoc Squad doesn't make excuses. I take full responsibility for my actions.
This isn't the Republic. I'm in charge, and I'm ready to pass judgment now.
No trial. Just my verdict.
Understood, Commander. I accept your decision.
Everyone here is doing their best, and I know you'll learn from this mistake. Let's all move on.
No punishment is necessary.
I won't have people thinking you're soft on me because of our relationship. I'm placing myself on maintenance detail whenever we're not on patrol.
As you wish, Major.
Thank you, Commander.
I let pride get the better of me. It won't happen again.
I expected more from a highly-trained special forces leader. The Alliance has no use for Havoc Squad. Leave. Don't come back.
You're exiled--forever.
I spent five years thinking you were dead. But this? It's worse.
We were fighting Arcann before you came along. That won't stop--but we'll keep out of your way.
And if Arcann should capture him? Force him to reveal our location?
That won't happen. I'll die first.
I believe him.
You abandoned the Republic and defied my Alliance. You've dishonored the Havoc Squad name. I can't trust you... and I won't have you disrupting my operations any further.
My sentence is death.
You... you can't. I love you.
You're not the man I fell in love with. I lost him years ago.
So, what? Toss me in the brig? Is that it?
We don't have a brig.
That's quite a way to end a relationship.
Good riddance. Can I go now?
That's how I deal with people who fail me. No exceptions for anyone. Understood?
Your point is well-taken, Commander.
Commander, I recommend these operatives be confined to base for the time being.
What? Forget that!
No, he's right. We didn't function like a team, and other people paid with their lives.
No one needs to be punished. I was supposed to lead the mission. If I had, maybe none of this would've happened.
I'm partially to blame.
That's an excellent point.
I'm just saying we skip the moping and get back to winning the war.
Remember why we fight, and don't forget this failure. Dismissed.
This is war. We can't always avoid casualties, but I expect you to get better at your jobs--and work together. Dismissed.
Just do better, next time.
You heard the Commander.
Until you earn back my trust, you're on maintenance detail.
You'll both work menial jobs.
I didn't sign up for that.
The more you talk back, the longer you'll spend scrubbing decks. Get moving--now.
If anything like this ever happens again, we're finished. Understood?
Mess up again, and we're done.
I guess we both changed a lot in five years.
Next time, do the smart thing. Send me in alone.
From now on, follow my orders to the letter. I don't want to replace Havoc Squad's commander--but I will.
Mess up again, and we're done.
I won't let you down again.
That won't be necessary.
No trial. Just my verdict.
Defend your actions, Jorgan.
Kaliyo, how do you plead?
My sanction will be swift.
